values.title: Components Part 1: Battery.hh, MovingWindowFilter.hh don't need Types.hh

values.description:
pull request #72 is too big, so this splits out part of it. Lots of code need to be moved to new folders for components, and this moves the headers to the component folders. It has some quick and dirty cmake code to handle the header files in the new location, which will be replaced once we switch to ign-cmake1. The auto-generated `common.hh` header file now does not include any of the moved header files.

Also, most of the headers are moved without modifications, but the `av/Utils.hh`, `events/Types.hh`, and `graphics/Types.hh` headers were created by splitting apart existing header files, so some modifications were made to `Mesh.hh`, `MeshManager.hh`, `SubMesh.hh`, and `Event.hh` to include the new header file.

* 385d43d move av header files

* bbe5fba move events header files

* 5d16bbb move graphics header files
values.title: Components Part 2: Move header files to component folders

summary.raw:
pull request #72 is too big, so this splits out part of it. Lots of code need to be moved to new folders for components, and this moves the headers to the component folders. It has some quick and dirty cmake code to handle the header files in the new location, which will be replaced once we switch to ign-cmake1. The auto-generated `common.hh` header file now does not include any of the moved header files.

Also, most of the headers are moved without modifications, but the `av/Utils.hh`, `events/Types.hh`, and `graphics/Types.hh` headers were created by splitting apart existing header files, so some modifications were made to `Mesh.hh`, `MeshManager.hh`, `SubMesh.hh`, and `Event.hh` to include the new header file.

* 385d43d move av header files

* bbe5fba move events header files

* 5d16bbb move graphics header files
summary.html:
pull request #72 is too big, so this splits out part of it. Lots of code need to be moved to new folders for components, and this moves the headers to the component folders. It has some quick and dirty cmake code to handle the header files in the new location, which will be replaced once we switch to ign-cmake1. The auto-generated common.hh header file now does not include any of the moved header files.

Also, most of the headers are moved without modifications, but the av/Utils.hh, events/Types.hh, and graphics/Types.hh headers were created by splitting apart existing header files, so some modifications were made to Mesh.hh, MeshManager.hh, SubMesh.hh, and Event.hh to include the new header file.

  • 385d43d move av header files

  • bbe5fba move events header files

  • 5d16bbb move graphics header files

values.description:
Many source files in `src` need to be moved to component `src` folders. Most of them are moved in this pull request, except for some files with problems on windows listed in [src/CMakeLists.txt](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/src/5361c388fb6689a87dad99e04f6665e9edbd343c/src/CMakeLists.txt?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#CMakeLists.txt-13:24). I also split the `av` functions out from `src/Util.cc` and moved them to `av/src/Util.cc` (4b36e63). I added just enough temporary cmake code to find these source files and add them to the variable `extra_sources`, which is used in the `ign_add_library` command.

It might help to review each commit:

* 519396b: move events src files (but not tests). Three source files are moved without modification. Some cmake and code_check.sh changes are included too.

* 65c8047: move most graphics src files (but not tests or files with windows problems). 21 source files are moved without modification ([diff stat here](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/f64e14d7187ea6d9072e3777da9a1afd)).

* 4b36e63: move av functions from src/Util.cc to av/src/Util.cc. Just the Util.cc files are modified.

*  2ae604f: added the other src folders to code_check.sh
values.title: Components Part 3: Move many src files to component folders

I added just enough temporary cmake code to find these source files and add them to the variable extra_sources, which is used in the ign_add_library command.

It might help to review each commit:

  • 4b36e63: move av functions from src/Util.cc to av/src/Util.cc. Just the Util.cc files are modified.

values.description:
At long last, this switches to `ign-cmake1` and uses components for av, events, and graphics. Much of the cmake logic from `src/CMakeLists.txt` is moved to the corresponding component.

Also, the header files for components are updated to use their component's `Export.hh` and visibility macros.

There was also ~~a small change to the paths in PluginLoader_TEST (db3e7f5) and~~ (moved to part 5) the removal of Export.hh from DummyPlugins.hh (db5a763).
values.title: Components Part 6: use ign-cmake1 and components for av, events, graphics

summary.raw:
At long last, this switches to `ign-cmake1` and uses components for av, events, and graphics. Much of the cmake logic from `src/CMakeLists.txt` is moved to the corresponding component.

Also, the header files for components are updated to use their component's `Export.hh` and visibility macros.

There was also ~~a small change to the paths in PluginLoader_TEST (db3e7f5) and~~ (moved to part 5) the removal of Export.hh from DummyPlugins.hh (db5a763).
summary.html:
At long last, this switches to ign-cmake1 and uses components for av, events, and graphics. Much of the cmake logic from src/CMakeLists.txt is moved to the corresponding component.

Also, the header files for components are updated to use their component's Export.hh and visibility macros.

There was also a small change to the paths in PluginLoader_TEST (db3e7f5) and (moved to part 5) the removal of Export.hh from DummyPlugins.hh (db5a763).

values.description: We've been accepting URLs with spaces on Ignition Fuel, and it would be nice to be able to use this class. This pull request is allowing spaces only on the path, not on the query.
values.title: Accept spaces on URI path

values.description:
Just when we had recovered from boost 1.67, ffmpeg4 has removed some macros. It's an easy fix though.

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_common-ci-ign-common1-homebrew-amd64&build=9)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-ign-common1-homebrew-amd64/9/) ignition_common-ci-ign-common1-homebrew-amd64/9/

There are some new deprecation warnings though for the `avcodec_register_all` function, though I'm not sure what the recommended replacement is. I haven't addressed them.

* https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/7e8eba2d8755962d9dca5eade57bf8f591a73c0c
values.title: fix build on homebrew with ffmpeg4

values.description:
Followup of [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/123](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/123) : separated URI-related changes to their own PR.

Closer to the RFCs defining an URI. Added URI Fragment support.

This now breaks URIs with spaces \(which do not follow the RFCs\), but these are now required in ign fuel. We must add support for URI encoding before these changes can be merged.
values.title: Several improvements to URI class.

summary.raw:
Followup of [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/123](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/123) : separated URI-related changes to their own PR.

Closer to the RFCs defining an URI. Added URI Fragment support.

This now breaks URIs with spaces \(which do not follow the RFCs\), but these are now required in ign fuel. We must add support for URI encoding before these changes can be merged.
summary.html:
Followup of #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/123 : separated URI-related changes to their own PR.

Closer to the RFCs defining an URI. Added URI Fragment support.

This now breaks URIs with spaces (which do not follow the RFCs), but these are now required in ign fuel. We must add support for URI encoding before these changes can be merged.

values.description:
This PR makes it easier to build gazebo `default` branch with ignition fuel support using colcon. The same change already exists on `default`. 

 Eliminating the variable from the `find_package()` call enables colcon to discover the dependency without needing a `package.xml` or `colcon.meta` entry.
values.title: Switch order of variable and find_package() for colcon

summary.raw:
This PR makes it easier to build gazebo `default` branch with ignition fuel support using colcon. The same change already exists on `default`. 

 Eliminating the variable from the `find_package()` call enables colcon to discover the dependency without needing a `package.xml` or `colcon.meta` entry.
summary.html:
This PR makes it easier to build gazebo default branch with ignition fuel support using colcon. The same change already exists on default.

Eliminating the variable from the find_package() call enables colcon to discover the dependency without needing a package.xml or colcon.meta entry.

values.description:
This is targeting a branch that is still a work in progress (WIP); I'm just making this to show @mxgrey some problems I'm seeing with that branch.

On bionic and osx, the `INTEGRATION_plugin` test fails for me, as no plugins are able to be loaded. To reduce console spam when that happens, this pull request adds some extra checks that will cause the test to fail early if plugins aren't loaded properly:

~~~
[ RUN      ] PluginLoader.LoadExistingLibrary
[Err] [PluginLoader.cc:454] Library [lib/libIGNDummyPlugins.so] does not export any plugins. The symbol [IGNCOMMONInputOrOutputPluginInfo] is missing, or it is not externally visible.
test/integration/plugin.cc:87: Failure
Expected: (pluginNames.size()) > (0u), actual: 0 vs 0
[  FAILED  ] PluginLoader.LoadExistingLibrary (0 ms)
~~~

I've tracked it down to the use of the `inline` keyword for the `IGNCOMMONInputOrOutputPluginInfo` symbol in `detail/RegisterPlugin.hh`.

If I add the following patch on top of this pull request, the test makes it a little farther:

~~~
diff -r 744a4ede9948 include/ignition/common/detail/RegisterPlugin.hh
--- a/include/ignition/common/detail/RegisterPlugin.hh	Mon Jun 11 14:15:41 2018 -0700
+++ b/include/ignition/common/detail/RegisterPlugin.hh	Tue Jun 19 00:45:22 2018 +0000
@@ -56,7 +56,7 @@
   ///
   /// The symbol is explicitly exported (visibility is turned on) using
   /// DETAIL_IGN_PLUGIN_VISIBLE to ensure that dlsym(~) is able to find it.
-  DETAIL_IGN_PLUGIN_VISIBLE inline void IGNCOMMONInputOrOutputPluginInfo(
+  DETAIL_IGN_PLUGIN_VISIBLE void IGNCOMMONInputOrOutputPluginInfo(
       const void *_inputSingleInfo,
       const void ** const _outputAllInfo,
       int *_inputAndOutputAPIVersion,
diff -r 744a4ede9948 test/plugins/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/test/plugins/CMakeLists.txt	Mon Jun 11 14:15:41 2018 -0700
+++ b/test/plugins/CMakeLists.txt	Tue Jun 19 00:45:22 2018 +0000
@@ -4,8 +4,7 @@
 add_library(IGNBadPluginSize          SHARED BadPluginSize.cc)
 add_library(IGNTemplatedPlugins       SHARED TemplatedPlugins.cc)
 add_library(IGNDummyPlugins SHARED
-  DummyPlugins.cc
-  DummyPluginsOtherTranslationUnit.cc)
+  DummyPlugins.cc)
 
 foreach(plugin_target
     IGNBadPluginAlign
~~~

values.title: WIP BetterPluginRegistration_DllManagement: add more error-checking

summary.raw:
This is targeting a branch that is still a work in progress (WIP); I'm just making this to show @mxgrey some problems I'm seeing with that branch.

On bionic and osx, the `INTEGRATION_plugin` test fails for me, as no plugins are able to be loaded. To reduce console spam when that happens, this pull request adds some extra checks that will cause the test to fail early if plugins aren't loaded properly:

~~~
[ RUN      ] PluginLoader.LoadExistingLibrary
[Err] [PluginLoader.cc:454] Library [lib/libIGNDummyPlugins.so] does not export any plugins. The symbol [IGNCOMMONInputOrOutputPluginInfo] is missing, or it is not externally visible.
test/integration/plugin.cc:87: Failure
Expected: (pluginNames.size()) > (0u), actual: 0 vs 0
[  FAILED  ] PluginLoader.LoadExistingLibrary (0 ms)
~~~

I've tracked it down to the use of the `inline` keyword for the `IGNCOMMONInputOrOutputPluginInfo` symbol in `detail/RegisterPlugin.hh`.

If I add the following patch on top of this pull request, the test makes it a little farther:

~~~
diff -r 744a4ede9948 include/ignition/common/detail/RegisterPlugin.hh
--- a/include/ignition/common/detail/RegisterPlugin.hh	Mon Jun 11 14:15:41 2018 -0700
+++ b/include/ignition/common/detail/RegisterPlugin.hh	Tue Jun 19 00:45:22 2018 +0000
@@ -56,7 +56,7 @@
   ///
   /// The symbol is explicitly exported (visibility is turned on) using
   /// DETAIL_IGN_PLUGIN_VISIBLE to ensure that dlsym(~) is able to find it.
-  DETAIL_IGN_PLUGIN_VISIBLE inline void IGNCOMMONInputOrOutputPluginInfo(
+  DETAIL_IGN_PLUGIN_VISIBLE void IGNCOMMONInputOrOutputPluginInfo(
       const void *_inputSingleInfo,
       const void ** const _outputAllInfo,
       int *_inputAndOutputAPIVersion,
diff -r 744a4ede9948 test/plugins/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/test/plugins/CMakeLists.txt	Mon Jun 11 14:15:41 2018 -0700
+++ b/test/plugins/CMakeLists.txt	Tue Jun 19 00:45:22 2018 +0000
@@ -4,8 +4,7 @@
 add_library(IGNBadPluginSize          SHARED BadPluginSize.cc)
 add_library(IGNTemplatedPlugins       SHARED TemplatedPlugins.cc)
 add_library(IGNDummyPlugins SHARED
-  DummyPlugins.cc
-  DummyPluginsOtherTranslationUnit.cc)
+  DummyPlugins.cc)
 
 foreach(plugin_target
     IGNBadPluginAlign
~~~

console output on bionic:

~~~
[ RUN      ] PluginLoader.LoadExistingLibrary
PluginLoader State
	Known Interfaces: 2
		test::util::DummyNameBase
		test::util::DummyGetSomeObjectBase
	Known Plugins: 2
		[test::util::DummyMultiPlugin] which implements 2 interfaces:
			test::util::DummyGetSomeObjectBase
			test::util::DummyNameBase
		[test::util::DummySinglePlugin] which implements 1 interface:
			test::util::DummyNameBase

/root/wsi/ignition/src/ign-common/test/integration/plugin.cc:94: Failure
Value of: pl.InterfacesImplemented().size()
  Actual: 2
Expected: 5u
Which is: 5
/root/wsi/ignition/src/ign-common/test/integration/plugin.cc:102: Failure
Value of: pl.PluginsImplementing<::test::util::DummyDoubleBase>().size()
  Actual: 0
Expected: 1u
Which is: 1
/root/wsi/ignition/src/ign-common/test/integration/plugin.cc:103: Failure
Value of: pl.PluginsImplementing("test::util::DummyDoubleBase").size()
  Actual: 0
Expected: 1u
Which is: 1
/root/wsi/ignition/src/ign-common/test/integration/plugin.cc:105: Failure
Value of: pl.PluginsImplementing( typeid(test::util::DummyDoubleBase).name(), false).size()
  Actual: 0
Expected: 1u
Which is: 1
/root/wsi/ignition/src/ign-common/test/integration/plugin.cc:131: Failure
Value of: secondPlugin->HasInterface<test::util::DummyDoubleBase>()
  Actual: false
Expected: true
/root/wsi/ignition/src/ign-common/test/integration/plugin.cc:132: Failure
Value of: secondPlugin->HasInterface("test::util::DummyDoubleBase")
  Actual: false
Expected: true
/root/wsi/ignition/src/ign-common/test/integration/plugin.cc:134: Failure
Value of: secondPlugin->HasInterface<test::util::DummyIntBase>()
  Actual: false
Expected: true
/root/wsi/ignition/src/ign-common/test/integration/plugin.cc:135: Failure
Value of: secondPlugin->HasInterface("test::util::DummyIntBase")
  Actual: false
Expected: true
/root/wsi/ignition/src/ign-common/test/integration/plugin.cc:137: Failure
Value of: secondPlugin->HasInterface<test::util::DummySetterBase>()
  Actual: false
Expected: true
/root/wsi/ignition/src/ign-common/test/integration/plugin.cc:138: Failure
Value of: secondPlugin->HasInterface("test::util::DummySetterBase")
  Actual: false
Expected: true
/root/wsi/ignition/src/ign-common/test/integration/plugin.cc:155: Failure
Expected: (nullptr) != (doubleBase), actual: 8-byte object <00-00 00-00 00-00 00-00> vs NULL
[  FAILED  ] PluginLoader.LoadExistingLibrary (1 ms)
~~~
summary.html:
This is targeting a branch that is still a work in progress (WIP); I'm just making this to show @mxgrey some problems I'm seeing with that branch.

On bionic and osx, the INTEGRATION_plugin test fails for me, as no plugins are able to be loaded. To reduce console spam when that happens, this pull request adds some extra checks that will cause the test to fail early if plugins aren't loaded properly:

[ RUN      ] PluginLoader.LoadExistingLibrary
[Err] [PluginLoader.cc:454] Library [lib/libIGNDummyPlugins.so] does not export any plugins. The symbol [IGNCOMMONInputOrOutputPluginInfo] is missing, or it is not externally visible.
test/integration/plugin.cc:87: Failure
Expected: (pluginNames.size()) > (0u), actual: 0 vs 0
[  FAILED  ] PluginLoader.LoadExistingLibrary (0 ms)

I've tracked it down to the use of the inline keyword for the IGNCOMMONInputOrOutputPluginInfo symbol in detail/RegisterPlugin.hh.

If I add the following patch on top of this pull request, the test makes it a little farther:

diff -r 744a4ede9948 include/ignition/common/detail/RegisterPlugin.hh
--- a/include/ignition/common/detail/RegisterPlugin.hh  Mon Jun 11 14:15:41 2018 -0700
+++ b/include/ignition/common/detail/RegisterPlugin.hh  Tue Jun 19 00:45:22 2018 +0000
@@ -56,7 +56,7 @@
   ///
   /// The symbol is explicitly exported (visibility is turned on) using
   /// DETAIL_IGN_PLUGIN_VISIBLE to ensure that dlsym(~) is able to find it.
-  DETAIL_IGN_PLUGIN_VISIBLE inline void IGNCOMMONInputOrOutputPluginInfo(
+  DETAIL_IGN_PLUGIN_VISIBLE void IGNCOMMONInputOrOutputPluginInfo(
       const void *_inputSingleInfo,
       const void ** const _outputAllInfo,
       int *_inputAndOutputAPIVersion,
diff -r 744a4ede9948 test/plugins/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/test/plugins/CMakeLists.txt   Mon Jun 11 14:15:41 2018 -0700
+++ b/test/plugins/CMakeLists.txt   Tue Jun 19 00:45:22 2018 +0000
@@ -4,8 +4,7 @@
 add_library(IGNBadPluginSize          SHARED BadPluginSize.cc)
 add_library(IGNTemplatedPlugins       SHARED TemplatedPlugins.cc)
 add_library(IGNDummyPlugins SHARED
-  DummyPlugins.cc
-  DummyPluginsOtherTranslationUnit.cc)
+  DummyPlugins.cc)

 foreach(plugin_target
     IGNBadPluginAlign

console output on bionic:

[ RUN      ] PluginLoader.LoadExistingLibrary
PluginLoader State
    Known Interfaces: 2
        test::util::DummyNameBase

    Known Plugins: 2
        [test::util::DummyMultiPlugin] which implements 2 interfaces:
            test::util::DummyGetSomeObjectBase
            test::util::DummyNameBase
        [test::util::DummySinglePlugin] which implements 1 interface:
            test::util::DummyNameBase

/root/wsi/ignition/src/ign-common/test/integration/plugin.cc:94: Failure
Value of: pl.InterfacesImplemented().size()
  Actual: 2
Expected: 5u
Which is: 5
/root/wsi/ignition/src/ign-common/test/integration/plugin.cc:102: Failure

  Actual: 0
Expected: 1u
Which is: 1
/root/wsi/ignition/src/ign-common/test/integration/plugin.cc:105: Failure
Value of: pl.PluginsImplementing( typeid(test::util::DummyDoubleBase).name(), false).size()
  Actual: 0
Expected: 1u
Which is: 1
/root/wsi/ignition/src/ign-common/test/integration/plugin.cc:131: Failure
Value of: secondPlugin->HasInterface<test::util::DummyDoubleBase>()
  Actual: false
Expected: true

values.description:
The WorkerPool.ThingsRunInParallel test is flaky on mac and windows:

* mac: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_common-ci-ign-common1-homebrew-amd64/13/testReport/junit/(root)/WorkerPool/ThingsRunInParallel/history/
* windows: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/455/testReport/junit/(root)/WorkerPool/ThingsRunInParallel/history/

this enables the flaky expectation only on Linux

values.description: This suppresses errors discussed in #36 since they appear to be false positives in cppcheck 1.82 (bionic version) that don't appear in earlier or later versions. We would need to figure out how to suppress this with `make codecheck`.
values.title: suppress cppcheck syntaxError on bionic since it appears to be a false positive

summary.raw: This suppresses errors discussed in #36 since they appear to be false positives in cppcheck 1.82 (bionic version) that don't appear in earlier or later versions. We would need to figure out how to suppress this with `make codecheck`.
summary.html: This suppresses errors discussed in #36 since they appear to be false positives in cppcheck 1.82 (bionic version) that don't appear in earlier or later versions. We would need to figure out how to suppress this with make codecheck.

values.description:
The ubuntu_auto builds have been failing for this repo because the pipelines configuration specifies ubuntu:16.04 instead of ubuntu:xenial, which caused apt to be configured incorrectly.

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_common-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=1)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/1/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/1/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_common-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=2)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/2/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/2/

We could probably work around this in release-tools, but it's easier to just fix this here.
values.title: use xenial instead of 16.04 in pipelines image to fix jenkins ubuntu_auto build

summary.raw:
The ubuntu_auto builds have been failing for this repo because the pipelines configuration specifies ubuntu:16.04 instead of ubuntu:xenial, which caused apt to be configured incorrectly.

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_common-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=1)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/1/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/1/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_common-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=2)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/2/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/2/

We could probably work around this in release-tools, but it's easier to just fix this here.
summary.html:
The ubuntu_auto builds have been failing for this repo because the pipelines configuration specifies ubuntu:16.04 instead of ubuntu:xenial, which caused apt to be configured incorrectly.

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/1/
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/2/

We could probably work around this in release-tools, but it's easier to just fix this here.
